description:
Fast in-silico MIRU-VNTR typing directly from long sequencing reads.

In-silico MIRU-VNTR typing using long reads.

Identify 24-locus MIRU-VNTR for Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex (MTBC) directly from long reads generated by Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT) and Pacific Biosciences (PacBio). Also work on assembled genome.
name: MIRUReader

metadata.abstract: Â© The Author(s) 2019. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved.Summary: Mycobacterial interspersed repetitive unit-variable number tandem repeat (MIRU-VNTR) typing is widely used to genotype Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex in epidemiological studies for tracking tuberculosis transmission. Recent long-read sequencing technologies from Pacific Biosciences and Oxford Nanopore Technologies can produce reads that are long enough to cover the entire repeat regions in each MIRU-VNTR locus which was previously not possible using the short reads from Illumina high-throughput sequencing technologies. We thus developed MIRUReader for MIRU-VNTR typing directly from long sequence reads. Availability and implementation: Source code and documentation for MIRUReader program is freely available at https://github.com/phglab/MIRUReader.
metadata.title: MIRUReader: MIRU-VNTR typing directly from long sequencing reads
